name: untenanted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe a building or land that does not have a tenant (= a person who pays rent for its use): It seemed unfair to make the owner pay tax on an untenanted house. Ranch House is an old, untenanted building situated about seven miles south of the city.
with nobody present: Her header towards the untenanted net bounced off the goalpost. He sat at an untenanted table and ordered eggs and coffee.
More examplesFewer examplesThe entrepreneur behind the company has bought up all the untenanted land in the area.Allotment holders are volunteering to keep untenanted plots tidy.The house had been untenanted for thirty years.
